meanings.definition: To tremble or shake involuntarily, typically as a result of fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She shuddered at the thought of spiders crawling on her.
meanings.sent2: The loud thunder made him shudder with fear.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so scary that even the bravest person shuddered.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident made her shudder with dread.
meanings.sent5: The icy wind made her shudder uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: To react with fear or repulsion.
meanings.sent1: He shuddered when he saw the creepy clown approaching.
meanings.sent2: The eerie sound from the dark alley made her shudder.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs made him shudder in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The thought of failing the test made her shudder with anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house made everyone shudder with fear.

meanings.sent1: The phone shuddered on the table as it received a notification.
meanings.sent2: The bridge shuddered under the weight of the passing trucks.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine shuddered before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The ground shuddered slightly as the train passed by.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches shuddered in the strong wind.
